moves.3... Qb6: Probably out of the opening book already
moves.10. Bxf5 dxc3 11. Kf2 Nxf5 12. gxf5: Already, Black has a significant advantage.
moves.12... Bc5 13. Qd3 cxb2 14. Ne2 O-O 15. B: I should have sac-ed the exchange here.
moves.23. fxe6 Rxe6 24. c4 dxc4 25. Qd7 Re7 26: Bad move (Monkey sees check, Monkey gives check)
What's up with these impotent checks?
moves.32... Kf7 33. Rd1 Qc4 34. Rd8 Qe6: Now the white Queen is cut off.
moves.36. Qd8 b1=Q 37. e4: In this position, I should have played Qh3! and it's all over for white. During the game, I didn't realize that the rook on e7 was defended by the Bishop on a3.
moves.37... Qc2+ 38. Kg3 Qe2 39. h4: Here, I should have played Qf1 and white can't prevent mate (either Qeh3# or Qfg1#).
moves.39... c2: Instead, I go for 3 Queens on the board.
moves.40. e5 c1=Q 41. Rxf6+: The rook sac is in vain.
moves.41... gxf6 42. Bxc1 Bxc1: White ran out of time. He would have been mated shortly.

gameName: Three Black Queens on the Board (GameKnot Blitz)
